channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive Waste Left Near Recycling Bins, 20th July
item.description:
An excessive amount of rubbish left near recycling bins on the corner of Upper Park Road and Erith Road, potentially causing a hazard to passing members of the public.

item.title: Overgrown bushes outside windows, 20th July
item.description:
Overgrown bushes right in front of the window of building 233-319 Villas Road. These haven’t been cut in over a year, and with the hot and dry weather they pose a fire hazard risks, on top of obstructing the windows. The beanches are now so long that the wind push them against the glass. I first flagged this issue over a month ago, and every time this gets marks as resolved because “it will be done on the next weekly cleanse”. Wondering which week of which year will this happen as this hasn’t been done in over a year! Please send someone over to trim them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villas Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface is very poor and will only get worse at the junction, 20th July
item.description:
The road surface at this junction requires attention as it could damage to cars and tyres As l understand the government has provided funds for the council to repair the poor road surface, the costs to place damaged types and wheel rims is very expensive, hopefully the council insurance would cover the costs for replacement of the items. As this was reported recently l noticed the a contract drove passed the junction and could have repaired the poor condition of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flats 26-34 Christchurch Ave, London, 20th July
item.description:
During the night of the 18th of July around 23.00pm, I was walking home, as the road is a little bit dark itself and the road broken (all the way around) I fall off on the floor hitting with my knees and hands on the paviment, provoking me an open wound in my hand, I am okay now but with pain in both hand and knee I will attached pictures of everything. This happened a road before where I live in NW6 7YN, the road where this happened is Flats 26-34 Christchurch Ave. I am reporting this issue as, under my concern, this road really needs to be fixed, it can be (or it is) a hazard as it is dangerous most of it for children and old people. I did attached all the information and pics here as I do not know where to put a complain regarding my injury. Hope at least to be heard on this problem. Kindest regards Claudia

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety bollards not closed. pedestrian and picnic area open to vehicles, 20th July
item.description:
Bollards to Newport Place still open. Lisle Street bollards still open. Both need to be closed by noon or 11am. PICNIC AREA, STREET DINING, AND PEDESTRIANS all vulnerable to vehicles. None suspect as they trust the Council.

item.title: Damage to paving and grass verge, 20th July
item.description:
A resident of no22 has been causing damage to pavement, kerb and grass verge by driving over the it to access his drive of which he doesn't have a dropped kerb for. This seems to have been going on for a while and has caused paving to be broken and a danger to the public as a trip hazard especially the elderly or disabled personnel who are wheel chair bound. This continuous bumping of motor vehicle up the kerb has caused damage and breakage to the kerb along with non existent grass at present due to constant using of driving over it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
